Key Match Events: Alex Hales and Jos Buttler smashed unbeaten half-centuries to chase down 169 for victory in just 6.2 overs, securing a 10-wicket win.
Post-Match Reflections: England captain Jos Buttler hit the winning runs with a six off Mohammed Shami, setting up a repeat of the 1992 50-over World Cup final between Pakistan and England.
Miscellaneous Highlights: KL Rahul began with a cracking boundary off Ben Stokes.
Seamer Chris Woakes had Rahul caught behind off a rising delivery for five.
Rohit Sharma hit four boundaries after a scratchy start as he and Kohli attempted to rebuild.
Jordan broke through in his first over and ended a 43-run partnership when Sharma mistimed to wide long-on with the score on 57.
Kohli passed 4,000 T20 international runs with a boundary off Liam Livingstone that took India’s total to 100-3 after 15 overs.
Kohli, who leads the tournament batting chart with 296 runs, reached 50 off 39 balls but fell next delivery to a sharp catch at short third man by Rashid off Jordan’s final ball of the innings.
Pandya smashed four fours and five sixes before treading on his stumps to be out hit wicket off Jordan’s final ball of the innings.
